intro: Lychnis senno, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are composed of five petals and are often arranged in clusters at the ends of stems. Lychnis senno is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
